question: 'Gas' in the tissue should be differenciates with:
exp: (Clostridium novyi) (124-Baily & Love 24th) (CSDT 12th) (109) (422-Baily & Love 25th)GAS - GANGRENE - caused by Clostridium perfringens* Gas and smell (mousy odour) are characteristic and crepitus.* Immunocompromised patients are most at risk.* Antibiotic prophylaxis is essential when performing amputation to remove dead tissues. 'Gas' in the tissue is not a good differentiating point since some clostridial species do not produce gas (clostri novyi) since non clostridial organisms often produce gas (E. coli) and since air can enter tissues through a penetrating wound.

question: Cellulitis is
exp: Ans. (b) A nonsuppurative invasive infection of tissues(Ref: Bailey and Love 27th Edition Page 48)* Cellulitis is a non suppurative invasive infection of Tissues, related to point of injury.* Poor localisation and spreading infection seen.* Caused by Beta Hemolytic Streptococci, Staphylococci and Clostridium perfringens.* Toxemia- Fever, Chills are common.* Blood Culture is negative.
opa: A suppurative invasive infection of skin and subcutaneous tissues
opb: A nonsuppurative invasive infection of tissues
opc: Infection caused by Gram negative bacilli
